intro: Hieracium carpetanum, commonly known as the Carpathian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn, and its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem. Hieracium carpetanum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh environments.
